newsitem.title: CANADA: Great-West sets new pfd share terms.
newsitem.headline: Great-West sets new pfd share terms.

text.p: The Great-West Life Assurance Company said on Friday that all holders of the company's series G and F redeemable preferred shares have agreed on new dividend rates and terms.

Great-West Life, a unit of Great-West Lifeco Inc., which is in turn a division of the Power Financial Corp group of companies, said a dividend rate of 4.83 per cent will apply on series G preferred shares from December 31, 1996 to December 30, 1999.
A dividend rate of 4.81 per cent will apply on the series F preferred shares from December 31, 1996 to December 30, 1998, the company said.

One million series G preferred shares were issued on August 1, 1991 for a total of C$25 million. Great-West Life redeemed 500,000 of the shares on December 31, 1996, at a price of C$25 per share for a total of C$12.5 million.

Two million series F preferred shares were issued on December 28, 1990 for a total of US$60 million. Great-West Life purchased for cancellation 300,000 of the series F preferred shares on October 3, 1995.
